page.title: 08STONE CIRCLES, BODMIN MOOR
page.content: A REMARKABLE PART OF LOCAL HISTORY IS STONE CIRCLES.THERE ARE OVER 20 {STONE {CIRCLES}IN CORNWALL CONCENTRATED ALMOST ENTIRELY ON BODMIN MOOR AND IN THE LANDS END PENINSULA AND CONSEQUENTLY ALL BUT ONE ARE MADE OF GRANITE.IT IS LIKELY THAT OTHERS HAVE BEEN DESTROYED OVER THE CENTURIES. ALL CIRCLES ARE ENCLOSED EXCEPT STRIPLE STONES ,WHICH WITH ITS ENDURING BANK AND DITCH,IS CLASSED AS A HENGE.LIKE THE OTHER CIRCLES ON BODMIN MOOR BOTH IN DIAMETER AS WELL AS IN NUMBER AND SIZE OF STONES,IT IS LARGER THAN THOSE AT LANDS END.SOMETIMES THE CIRCLES ARE NOT ALWAYS ROUND.THERE ARE 5 STONE CIRCLES IN OUR AREA ROUGHLY 30 FT. ACROSS AND WITH A CIRCUMFERENCE OF 75FT.MOST OF THE STONE CIRCLES HAVE A MOUND AROUND THEM.ALL STONE CIRCLES IN OUR AREA ARE MADE OF GRANITE.
